result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vernon Mitchell Hayes Jr.

records.addlTxt:
8:32 AM Defendant Vernon Mitchell Hayes Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Vernon Mitchell Hayes Jr.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 22CF176, 22CF177, and 22CF178. State recites agreement. State notes that there have been many discussions between the parties regarding sentencing. 22CF178 will be dismissed but read in. In 22CF176, defendant will plead to the amended misdemeanor count. Withheld sentence in favor of 1 year of probation, concurrent to 22CF177. Conditions of DOC programming, No contact with Victims in all 3 files, payment of court costs, and 145 days conditional jail with credit for 145 days (time served). Defendant will plead to the sole count in 22CF177. Withheld sentence in favor of 30 months of probation, concurrent to 22CF176. Conditions of DOC programming, no contact with Victims in all 3 files, and payment of court costs. 
Defendant pleads no contest to amended charge in 22CF176 and to sole count in 22CF177. Attorney Gramstrup stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the pleas, finds that the pleas have freely and voluntarily made. Defendant is found guilty. Court dismisses but reads in 22CF178.
Court orders in 22CF176, withheld sentence in favor of 1 year of probation, concurrent to 22CF177. Conditions of DOC programming, no contact with Victims in all 3 files, payment of court costs, and 149 days conditional jail with credit for 149 days (time served). 
Court orders in 22CF177. Withheld sentence in favor of 30 months probation, concurrent to 22CF176. Conditions of DOC programming, no contact with Victims in all 3 files, payment of court costs, and 149 days conditional jail with credit for 149 days (time served).
Transcript of Preliminary Hearing from May 25, 2022
Motion to Admit Statements
Motion to Dismiss filed by Defendant

8:30 AM Defendant Vernon Mitchell Hayes Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Vernon Mitchell Hayes Jr.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. State notes a new date for speedy trial. Court resets jury trial and status conference. Attorney Gramstrup makes argument on bail modification. Defendant could post $5,000 cash bail. State is opposed to bail modification. There are three cases totaling $10,000 cash and finds amount is appropriate given each charge. Defendant does have prior charges had a fta in 2019 and probation violation in St. Louis County. Attorney Gramstrup notes his local ties with family living in the area. Asks for $5,000 cash with significant signature bond. Court finds bail amount in 22CF178 is appropriate given the charge. Court amends bond in 22CF176 to $500 cash bail and conditions of no contact with Victim #1. In 22CF177, Court amends to $500 cash bail and condition of no contact with victim #1, The above no contact shall have the exception that Defendant may have third party contact only for the purposes of child custody or placement. No contact with 1115 Cypress Ave and one time to address with law enforcement for property retrieval.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Affidavit in Support of Motion
Motion to Modify Bail

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
2:12 PM Defendant Vernon Mitchell Hayes Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Vernon Mitchell Hayes Jr.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 22CF176, 22CF177, and 22CF178. Court notes that Attorney Nelsen has filed a motion to withdraw as counsel due to the request of the defendant. State takes no position on the motion. Defendant indicates that he would like a new lawyer assigned to the cases. Reviews that the defendant has made a speedy trial demand has been made in 22CF178and informs the defendant that the trial set for Sept 15 may be delayed due to new counsel being assigned. Defendant understands this. Court will sign order for withdrawal of counsel. Status set to check in on status of counsel.
Status conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion hearing on July 14, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Motion and Order Permitting Withdrawal of Counsel

9:01 AM Defendant Vernon Mitchell Hayes Jr. in court, in custody.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Vernon Mitchell Hayes Jr.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Acknowledges receipt, waives reading, pleads not guilty. Speedy trial demand in 21CF178. Court sets dates.
Jury trial scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Arraignment on June 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

1:51 PM Prosecuting attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Vernon Mitchell Hayes Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ryan Anthony Reid in court for Vernon Mitchell Hayes Jr. Attorney Reid received complaints in each case, waives reading and requests preliminary hearing. State requests in 22CF176, $2,500 cash bail with conditions of no contact with Victim #1, The above no contact shall have the exception that Defendant may have third party contact only for the purposes of child custody or placement. One time contact with law enforcement to retrieve belongings. No contact with 1115 Cypress Ave. In 22CF177, $2,500 cash bail and condition of no contact with Victim #1. In 22CF178, $5,000 cash bail and condition of no contact with Victim #1. Defendant has priors in Wisconsin. Defendant has prior conviction with prison sentence. Attorney Reid requests $2,000 cash bail in 22CF176,22CF177 and 22CF178. Defendant has been a local resident and is self employed. Does not contest to criminal history listed. Court orders in 22CF176, $2,500 cash bail with conditions of no contact with Victim #1, The above no contact shall have the exception that Defendant may have third party contact only for the purposes of child custody or placement. One time contact with law enforcement to retrieve belongings. No contact with 1115 Cypress Ave. In 22CF177, $2,500 cash bail with condition of no contact with Victim #1. in 22CF178, $5,000 cash bail with condition of no contact with Victim #1.

3:48 PM Defendant Vernon Mitchell Hayes appeared by video, in custody. Prosecuting attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ellen Craker appears by video. Attorney Craker updates address. State requests $5,000 cash bail and conditions of no contact with Victim #1 or their residence. State reviews dated criminal history which includes prison on a charge. A fta in 2019. Attorney Craker notes family local and is self employed in the area. Prior criminal history is very dated. Court questions what defendant could post. Defendant states he could come up with some amount. Court orders $2,000 cash bail with conditions of no contact with Victim #1 or their address.
Hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
